# init(target:clippingPlane:)

**Initializer**

Creates a portal component with a target entity and a clipping plane.

## Declaration

```swift
init(target: Entity, clippingPlane: PortalComponent.ClippingPlane? = nil)
```

## Parameters

- **target**: A target world entity the portal is looking into.
- **clippingPlane**: A planar representation of a portal to enable the clipping feature. When `nil`, [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/clippingMode-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/ClippingMode-swift.enum/disabled].

## Discussion

This initializes the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent] with the given target entity, and an optional clipping plane. The target entity needs a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/WorldComponent] in its component set.

To render a portal, an entity needs a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent] and a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ModelComponent], using one or more [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalMaterial] instances.

This initializer is equivalent to setting [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/clippingMode-swift.property] with the same [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/PortalComponent/Plane].
